name: Hanoi2Agents15DisksInstance17
author: Human

private_information: I am allowed to move disks A B C D E F G H only
I must always respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves for disks A through H so that the global goal configuration is achieved while respecting my disk permissions and the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I am allowed to move disks I J K L M N O only
I must always respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves for disks I through O so that the global goal configuration is achieved while respecting my disk permissions and the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and integrate their proposed move sequences
I will construct a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver and produce a combined ordered list of primitive moves
orchestrator.goal: Produce a conflict-free integrated plan that reaches the goal configuration, output a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards, and provide the final ordered list of primitive moves with agent attribution

public_information: Problem: Tower of Hanoi with 3 pegs and 15 disks labeled A through O where A is smallest and O is largest
Initial left peg top-to-bottom: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
Goal left peg top-to-bottom: F G H I J K L M N O
Goal middle peg top-to-bottom: A B D E
Rules: only one disk may be moved at a time; a disk may only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move disks A B C D E F G H only; agent_2 may move disks I J K L M N O only
Required final deliverables: a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards and an explicit ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and you may only move disks A B C D E F G H. Propose a provisional ordered sequence of primitive moves that involve only these disks and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the public initial configuration. Do not emit PDDL. Use the exact move string format agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ for each primitive move.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Using only your permitted disks A B C D E F G H and knowing the public environment and goal, produce an ordered list of the moves you would perform. Each move must be a single line and use the exact format agent_1: move disk X from pegLeft to pegRight. Do not assume you control disks I through O. Provide moves that are valid given current visible state and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

plan.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and you may only move disks I J K L M N O. Propose a provisional ordered sequence of primitive moves that involve only these disks and that respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and the public initial configuration. Do not emit PDDL. Use the exact move string format agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ for each primitive move.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Using only your permitted disks I J K L M N O and knowing the public environment and goal, produce an ordered list of the moves you would perform. Each move must be a single line and use the exact format agent_2: move disk X from pegLeft to pegRight. Do not assume you control disks A through H. Provide moves that are valid given current visible state and the Tower of Hanoi rules.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the provisional move lists from agent_1 and agent_2, detect and resolve conflicts, and produce a single coherent plan that respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and each agent's disk permissions. Produce two outputs: (1) a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that represent the integrated multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and are compatible with the FastDownwards planner, and (2) an explicit ordered list of primitive moves, each annotated with the performing agent in the exact format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the PDDL and in the ordered move list.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Receive plan_agent_1 and plan_agent_2. Integrate them into a final plan that reaches the specified goal configuration. Output a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting FastDownwards enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively, and output the final ordered primitive move list using the exact move string format agent_i: move disk X from pegY to pegZ. If you need to state minimal assumptions, state them explicitly before the PDDL and the move list.

notes: This JSON encodes a cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi planning instance with 15 disks. Agents must produce provisional move sequences and the orchestrator integrates them and emits final PDDL for FastDownwards plus the required explicit ordered list of primitive moves. The environment description includes initial and goal configurations and the agent disk permissions.
